bug.summary: Unexpected behavior: `model.train()` is not called without validation loop
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
The lightning module's method is never called unless validation is implemented. This causes issue with e.g. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/master/pl_examples/domain_templates/computer_vision_fine_tuning.py>the new transfer learning example</denchmark-link> where the is overridden and used to freeze layers. It only works with a validation loop. (Note that the example linked above did an equivalent of in ) I don't think this behavior is documented. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run this google colab: <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/10aoFWAaOE-Epm88Io9bHxgsIfHGhr8cS>https://colab.research.google.com/drive/10aoFWAaOE-Epm88Io9bHxgsIfHGhr8cS</denchmark-link>
And it would show that CoolSystemNoVal does not call .train(), only CoolSystemWithVal does. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
.train() called no matter for CoolSystemNoVal or CoolSystemWithVal <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
It's google colab.
